required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 2 Study With Enzastaurin Plus Chemotherapy or Placebo Plus Chemotherapy for Prostate Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blinded, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 2 Study With and Without Enzastaurin in Combination With Docetaxel and Prednisone, Followed By Enzastaurin Maintenance as First-Line Treatment in Hormone Refractory Metastatic Prostate Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the response rates for prostate cancer patients taking chemotherapy plus enzastaurin versus chemotherapy plus placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To determine response rate of enzastaurin given with chemotherapy in prostate cancer patients when they have taken enzastaurin for a maximum of 3 years

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess rate of PSA level decline of greater than or equal to 30%
To characterize the pharmacokinetics of enzastaurin

intervention.description: 1125 mg loading dose then 500 mg, oral, daily, until disease progression, toxicity, or maximum 3 years
75 mg/m2, IV, q 21 days, six 21 day cycles, maximum 10 cycles
5 mg, oral, BID, six 21 day cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- You are at least 18 years old.
- You live close enough to the doctor's office to attend all of your required visits.
- You have not been treated with chemotherapy for your prostate cancer.
- Your organs must be functioning properly.
Exclusion Criteria:
- You are unable to swallow pills.
- You have another serious illness besides your prostate cancer.
- You have taken another experimental drug within the last 30 days.
- You have a serious heart condition.
- You are receiving another anti-cancer therapy.
